title: 107_s1656
content: The Act may be cited as the "Veterans Benefits Administration Improvement Act of 2001". The Veterans Benefits Administration is responsible for processing claims for veterans compensation and pension. Concerns have been raised about the accuracy of claims processing, despite reported high accuracy rates. The Veterans Benefits Administration reported a 95 percent accuracy rate in processing claims in the past, but a new accuracy measurement system found that initial reviews were accurate only 64 percent of the time in 1998 and 2000. Adequate training for claims adjudicators is crucial as the administration could lose up to 30 percent of its workforce to retirement by 2003. In 2000, initial reviews of veterans claims were accurate only 64 percent of the time. The Veterans Benefits Administration could lose up to 30 percent of its workforce to retirement by 2003, emphasizing the need for adequate training for claims adjudicators. It is crucial for the administration to take more aggressive steps to ensure accurate and timely processing of veterans claims to avoid unnecessary delays in providing compensation and pension benefits. The Veterans Benefits Administration must improve processing of veterans claims to avoid delays in providing compensation and pension benefits. In 2001, the expected appeals processing time for a claim was 621 days, with a backlog of 533,029 claims as of September 2001. The Veterans Benefits Administration must improve processing of veterans claims to avoid delays in providing compensation and pension benefits. SEC. 3. IMPROVEMENT OF PROCESSING OF VETERANS BENEFITS CLAIMS. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a plan for improving the processing of veterans' compensation and pension claims within 90 days of this Act. The plan should include mechanisms for enhancing training of claims adjudicators and employee accountability standards to ensure timely reviews of claims. The plan for improving processing of veterans' compensation and pension claims must include mechanisms for training adjudicators, enhancing employee accountability, and identifying recurring errors in claims adjudications. The plan includes mechanisms for strengthening the Veterans Benefits Administration's ability to identify recurring errors in claims adjudications by improving data collection and management related to common impairments and deficiencies in medical evidence. It also involves implementing a system for reviewing claims processing accuracy. The plan includes mechanisms for reviewing claims processing accuracy, evaluating the impact of the Training and Performance Support System on claims processing, and addressing common impairments and deficiencies in medical evidence. The plan includes mechanisms for evaluating the impact of the Training and Performance Support System on claims processing accuracy, with consultation from veterans organizations and other interested parties. The plan for evaluating the impact of the Training and Performance Support System on claims processing includes quantifiable goals for developed mechanisms. The Secretary must consult with veterans organizations and other interested parties in developing the plan and can modify it as needed, with implementation starting 60 days after submission. The Secretary will implement the plan for evaluating the Training and Performance Support System's impact on claims processing 60 days after submission. The plan can be modified by the Secretary, with any changes taking effect 30 days after notifying relevant committees. Reports are due by January 1, 2003, and every six months thereafter. The Secretary will implement the plan for evaluating the Training and Performance Support System's impact on claims processing within 60 days of submission. Any modifications to the plan will take effect 30 days after notifying relevant committees. Reports assessing plan implementation are due by January 1, 2003, and every six months thereafter. The Secretary will submit a report assessing the implementation of the plan for the Veterans Benefits Administration every six months to relevant committees. Funding for the plan will be carried out using appropriated amounts for each fiscal year.
